channel.title: Need help. java and linux
channel.description:
alright, so lets start this off.
first off. i have no clue about linux. so please work with me.
i know how to do this on windows, but im having trouble with it on linux. what i am trying to do is execute a batch file through my java program.
the way i am doing it on windows is this. [code]
String command = "cmd /C start ping.cmd"; Runtime rt = Runtime.getRuntime(); Process pr = rt.exec(command);
[/code]
now see, if i am doing it on linux, should i be using a .sh instead of a .cmd? if so, are the commands in .sh the same as .cmd? help please, i dont know anything about linux lol :)

item.title: Need help. java and linux
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

abraham2119:

sh

what he meant to say was, use sh instead of cmd, go on google for how to make a correct DoS-ping-while-loop on linux

Read full topic

item.description:

alright, so lets start this off.

first off. i have no clue about linux. so please work with me.

i know how to do this on windows, but im having trouble with it on linux.
what i am trying to do is execute a batch file through my java program.

the way i am doing it on windows is this.


		       String command = "cmd /C start ping.cmd";     
     		       Runtime rt = Runtime.getRuntime();      
		       Process pr = rt.exec(command);

now see, if i am doing it on linux, should i be using a .sh instead of a .cmd?
if so, are the commands in .sh the same as .cmd?
help please, i dont know anything about linux lol
